revised_title: Investigating the Composition of Water and Dephlogisticated Air
tldr: James Watt investigates the composition of water and dephlogisticated air through experiments involving the deflagration of a mixture of these two airs. He concludes that the deflagration produces a quantity of water equal in weight to the airs, suggesting that water may be composed of dephlogisticated air and phlogiston deprived of their latent heat.
